author: bridge-bot
content:
<notnotstorm_p> re: **@gas_limit_testing_bot**
> <ben_a_adams> [reply]: Here you go; can discussion on the eth magician's thread for this EIP (x100 gaslimit in 4 years) https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/9698
I like the attitude of this EIP but I also expect that waiting 2 years to 10x will end up being overly cautious

the primary objective of this working group should be 1) to inform what kind of gas limit schedule is realistic + safe and 2) to identify the bottlenecks that will appear at each level of the schedule

it would be great if we could work toward some sort of structured public deliverable that outlines every single bottleneck in the system and the amount of gas limit that each of those bottlenecks can support. this deliverable should make it easy to determine 1) what kind of gas limit is currently safe and 2) what improvements are needed to reach a given gas limit

I think Dankrad's new EIP is currently ok. but it would be a lot better if it was loosely based on this type of deliverable
